head.supplied: 11/5/70 ¶ ¶ Allow me to remind you, dear Mr. Odgers, that the boys ¶ have not yet arrived. The Garden becomes a wilderness, if I do not soon get the aid of the boys, this being my most busy season. ...

div.p: W70/5162, unit 541, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Allow me to remind you, dear Mr. Odgers, that the boys
i.e. from the Industrial Schools. M's letter was referred to the Inspector of Industrial Schools, George O. Duncan, who replied on 14 May 1870 'the boys will be down on Saturday next'. See also M to W. Odgers, 17 May 1870. have not yet arrived. The Garden becomes a wilderness, if I do not soon get the aid of the boys, this being my most busy season.
